SENT.plain: A computer-based communications system was established for a quadriplegic patient who suffered a brainstem infarction that left him with normal intelligence, but without speech and without functional motor control except for the thumb of his right hand
An arm brace was developed to support the hand and thumb so it could control two switches that generated Morse code signals
An interface was also devised to translate Morse code into ASCII characters to access a personal computer
Additional codes were added to represent keyboard control functions
This device allows the patient to communicate with others and control, to some extent, his environment
